result.execSummary:
The defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served, straight time.
*Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Provide DNA Sample.
*Restitution set at ZERO.

*No contact with firearms.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

*No contact with victim Jenny S. unless approved by agent.
 Court granted 3rd party contact for visitation with the child.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

*AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 60 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chazz Anthony Loyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 03-25-16 Court order imposing 60 days of condition time.

Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court amended probation conditions to reflect 60 days condition time stayed. Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No contact with victim Jenny S. unless approved by agent. Court granted 3rd party contact for visitation with the child.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.
Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Case adjourned to branch 24 for a Probation Review Hearing.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Due to defense unavailability, with permission from the court, case adjourned to 12/18/2015 at 1:30 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant not produced. Court ordered case adjourned to branch 24 for a Sentencing Hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

JusticePoint Pretrial Services violation report: new charges filed, received and filed.
Court is reviewing report.

Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 11/18/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
from the state received and filed.   rmm
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed telephone contact) received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a status of counsel hearing.   Defendant requests a court appointed attorney.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based on defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Michael Chernin as counsel for defendant.  Attorney Chernin accepts the appointment.  Order signed and filed.   Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect. Court ordered case adjourned in branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for 09-04-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation.
Defendant informs Court that he is attempting to obtain counsel.  Court will grant another adjournment and orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.
Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.  Defendant should have counsel present in court with him on the next court date.

Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge DALLET.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 40.
